message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the characteristics of an open flame. When an open flame is produced, one of its byproducts is warmth. Option (A) is incorrect because cooking is not a byproduct of an open flame, but rather a purposeful activity that can be done using an open flame. Option (C) is incorrect because an open flame does not produce cold. Option (D) is incorrect because although light is produced by an open flame, it is not a byproduct, but rather one of the main components of an open flame.

Option (D) is incorrect because while flames do produce light, it is not the byproduct being referred to in this question.
